column5: Hi all,  Shot my first ever birds out by myself using my own gun. Got 3 in all, 1 grouse and 2 spruce hens. They were pretty tame and allowed me to follow them into the bush a fair ways, got really close to all of them.  Got some nice splake yesterday so lunch is looking pretty good, got the spruce hens in brine at the moment and a nice wild chanterell sauce to accompany for the ultimate surf and turf!   Video has some blood....
Nice spruceys, and that does sound like the ultimate surf and turf.  I'd like to hear more about this chantrell sauce

Nice spruceys, and that does sound like the ultimate surf and turf. I'd like to hear more about this chantrell sauce  It is just thoughts in my grey matter at the moment, thinking about sautee breast in garlic and shallots then add chaterelles, …..dash of cognac or sherry….cream….something like that…then grill trout with a lemon butter and flaked almonds…..
Sounds amazing!  Id run with it!
Ended up taking the trout next door to be put in a smoker, grouse are gonna be a cassoulet now...basically a mixed meat and sausage stew with beans and wine.
Nice Simon and love the bolt single.
I really like the little gun, a buddy gave it to me. It can take a clip but they are hard to come by and mine is missing. It is simple but effective, just like my logic in most instances....lol.
GOTCHYA!!!  DONE!  RIGHT IN THE HEAD!  Cool Simon.
LOL Drew...is that what I actually say? I was excitable.....lol.
